title: Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher nearly lose umbrellas as they battle freak gust of wind
text:

Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher nearly lost their umbrellas when a freak gust of wind took them by surprise live on Sky Sports.

The pundits were trying to provide analysis ahead of Southampton's Premier League clash with Leicester City when the weather caught them off guard.

Kelly Cates did her best to keep Neville grounded as he gripped his umbrella for dear life and Carragher was blown backwards.

Fortunately both men stayed on their feet and inside the parameters of St Mary's, with Kelly suggesting they abandon using the brollies and brave the wind and rain.

The UK is bracing itself for more bad weather this weekend as the clocks go back, with floods expected in some parts.

(Image: @SkySportsPL/Twitter)

Met Office spokeswoman Nicola Maxey said: "The areas most at risk are the areas that are within the warning areas, so you've got parts of Cumbria and the Pennines.

"There's a warning over Wales and then there's another warning over parts of the South West.

"We're looking at 30mm to 50mm of rain quite widely, with perhaps 120mm over higher ground for the warning in south Wales.

"We've also got some polar maritime air moving in across the country, so where this warmer air that's coming up from the south meets the colder air, you see the heaviest rain at that point.

(Image: @SkySportsPL/Twitter)

"Because of the colder air, there's a possibility that some of the rain may fall as snow, but only over very high ground in the north.

"You might see a dusting on top of the Pennines, and you may see a centimetre or two over the mountains in Scotland."
description: The Sky Sports pundits were trying to provide analysis ahead of Southampton's clash with Leicester City
